Description: Columbus Steel Castings Company, Inc., located on the south side of Columbus, Ohio, was sentenced to pay $825,000 and install additional devices to prevent air pollution after pleading guilty on July 28, 2011 to six counts of violating the Clean Air Act. The violations include failing to operate air pollution controls, failing to report violations, failing to perform required monitoring, and failing to conduct stack testing to demonstrate compliance with the Clean Air Act.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 332999: All Other Miscellaneous Fabricated Metal Product Manufacturing
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Columbus Steel Castings agreed to pay a $660,000 criminal penalty and a $165,000 community service payment to resolve allegations of Clean Air Act violations. The settlement was also announced by the U.S. EPA; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/oh-columbus-steel-castings-company
Columbus Castings agreed to pay a $186,700 civil penalty and fund Supplemental Environmental Projects worth $250,000 in settlement of allegations its facility violated its air emissions permit.
